glossary.Description: A list that is added at the end of the project report to indicate the resources that have been referred to.
The most widely known and used learning model, developed by educators, Mike Eisenberg and Bob Berkowitz, to impart information and technology skills.

The three Boolean operators defined by George Boole. The operator AND is used to narrow down the search by combining two or more keywords, operator OR is used to expand the search by using alternative keywords while operator NOT is used to eliminate a concept or keyword that is irrelevant, yet closely related to the main idea.
The act of referencing to the original work using styles such as Modern Language Association (MLA) and American Psychological Association (APA).
The ability to learn from the media.
The ability to access different types of Web content on the Internet.

Learning model developed by the International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions, Action for Development through Libraries Programme (IFLA-ALP) and the National Institute of Library and Information Sciences (NILIS) of Sri Lanka to create awareness of information skills for learning.
To judge the value or condition of (someone or something) in a careful and thoughtful way.
A life skill, critical to survive and flourish in society today and in the future. It consists of the ability to identify, locate, evaluate and use information efficiently and effectively.
The economy of the 21st century that is information-driven, and which calls for information literacy rather than computer literacy.
The libguide is a collection of resource guides and bibliography compiled by librarians to help you in your research on various topics.
Learning model developed by NLB Singapore to implement Project Work at the school level.
NLB's programme that has been designed in partnership with educators and librarians to educate the public, including students, on how to search, retrieve and use the information.
The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusion.
A place, person or thing from which something originates or can be obtained.
The ability to use computer applications.
The ability to learn through visuals.
